subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Imposter Syndrome: Feeling Like a Fraud
description: A fast breakdown of Imposter Syndrome: Feeling Like a Fraud for builders.

hook.text: Maya Angelou wrote eleven books and still said, 'I've fooled everybody. They're going to find me out.'

buildup.text: Imposter syndrome is the persistent belief that your success is undeserved and you'll soon be exposed.

discovery.text: It disproportionately affects high achievers. The more you accomplish, the more you fear being found out.

twist.text: For founders, it's amplified. You're building something newâ€”there's no proof you know what you're doing.

climax.text: Sheryl Sandberg, Howard Schultz, and Mike Cannon-Brookes all publicly admitted to imposter feelings.

punchline.text: If you feel like a fraud, you're probably doing something brave.

quiz.question: Who is most likely to experience imposter syndrome?
options: High achievers operating outside their comfort zone
People with low self-esteem and no accomplishments
Only first-time entrepreneurs with no experience
